page.title: 20OTHER FEATURES NEAR YANWORTH
page.content: Probably starting at Droitwich, one {White Way or Salt Way }passed Compton Casey _ through Chedworth Wood _ and so to Cirencester and beyond. At {Compton Casey }the partly demolished{17 C. mansion, }once a farm house, is now a privately rented home with few signs of the former elegance. {The railway,(1881/1883 to c.1960) was a slow rural link for Cheltenham / Cirencester.Foss Cross station handled farm crops, quarry stone and coal. The{disused airfield,1942-1945}was used for training purposes_ especially the Mosquito light bomber. After D Day June 6 1944, hurt American airmen were flown here to their nearby hospital. {Chedworth Nature Reserve }is noted for its Oolitic limestone exposures. {CREDITS. THE SUMMER 1985 DOMESDAY {SURVEY AROUND YANWORTH WAS CARRIED OUT {BY B. PEARSON _ WITH MUCH LOCAL HELP.
